subject: CEBS
title: Employee Benefits Concepts
info: Overview of the environment of employee benefit plans. Hospital plans, surgical/medical expense plans, major medical plans, dental/vision care, health care cost containment, managed care, long-term care, HMOs, preferred provider organizations. Certificate credit course (3 credits).

subject: CEBS
title: Contemporary Benefit Issues
info: Employer administrative issues such as fiduciary liability, acccounting for postretirement benefits, international benefits, outsourcing, and new technologies. New types of benefits such as long-term care insurance. Work/family issues in plan design. This is a certificate credit course  (3 credits).

subject: CEBS
title: Personal Financial Planning 1
info: Cash flow. Financial statements and debt analysis. Time value of money.  Management of liability, disability, life, medical, and property risks.  Investment/portfolio management. Tax reduction, employee benefits, retirement/estate plannings, ethical/family values, regulation of financial planners.

subject: CEBS
title: Employee Benefits:  Design
info: Group insurance mechanism, life insurance benefits, short-/long-term disability income, employee-assistance programs, dependent care arrangements, death benefits, flexible benefits, family leave, unemployment benefits, employee discounts, educational benefits, credit unions, management topics. Certificate credit course.

subject: CEBS
title: Retirement Plans: Basic Featur
info: Historical introduction to private-pension-plan development. Objectives of benefit plan design. Analysis of defined benefit/defined contribution plans. Approaches to retirement plan design. Certificate credit course.

subject: CEBS
title: Retirement Plans: Def Benefit
info: Overview of retirement aspects of Social Security. Defined benefit features. Hybrid approaches (cash balance/target benefit plans). Actuarial/accounting aspects of defined benefit plan sponsorship, basic concepts of investing pension assets, taxation of retirement benefits, nonqualified approaches to retirement income. Certificate credit course.

subject: CEBS
title: Contemporary Legal Env
info: Legal system, basic legal rights/responsibilities, legal environment. Focuses on concepts/principles of significance in employee benefit planning/administration.

subject: CEBS
title: Financial Concepts and Practic
info: Financial/accounting concepts essential in administration of employee benefit plans. Role of accounting as system of communicating information to users inside/outside an organization. Concepts, principles, and techniques of financial management.

subject: CEBS
title: Asset Management
info: Asset management in investing pension plan assets. Securities markets, stock/bond valuation/analysis, portfolio theory, investment policy, federal securities regulation. Certificate credit course.

subject: CEBS
title: Human Resources & Compensation
info: Survey of human resources management and of compensation administration. Total compensation concepts, human resources planning, employee benefits, noneconomic rewards, seniority, management rights, union security. Certificate credit course.

subject: CEBS
title: Health Economics
info: Economic principles underlying inflation, national income, business cycles, employment levels, money/banking, monetary/fiscal policy, and their effect on employee benefits. Determining national income/employment in relation to inflation, unemployment, and various measures of national income. Effect of government activities on equilibrium level of national income.
